main event: John Doe observed an unidentified flying object over the New York World's Fair in New York City on May 6, 1964.
interesting points: The object was described as round, silver, and hovering silently above the fairgrounds., John Doe estimated the object to be approximately 50 feet in diameter., The sighting lasted for several minutes before the object accelerated rapidly and disappeared from view., Project Blue Book investigators interviewed John Doe but found no corroborating evidence., The sighting remains classified as 'unidentified' in Project Blue Book records.
location: New York City, New York, USA
